text: Ravi Rana is an Indian independent politician, a 3rd time MLA presently representing the Badnera (Vidhan Sabha constituency) in Amravati District of Vidarbha region of Maharashtra in the 13th Maharashtra Legislative Assembly). ==Life and career== He married to a film star Navneet Kaur, who has worked in many South Indian films. Their marriage took place in a mass marriage ceremony at a specially organised function where along with him and Kaur, 3100 other couples also got married. This event took place on 3 February 2011 in the presence of many leaders and very important persons. Then Chief Minister of Maharashtra Prithviraj Chavan and Baba Ramdev, remained present to bless the newly wed couple and the other more than 3100 couples belonging to various castes and religions. On 6 October 2015, Rana stopped an encroachment on a local barber's shop. In 2019 General elections to Maharashtra vidhan sabha he defeated Shiv Sena candidate Priti Sanjay Band with a margin of 15541 votes and became mla third time in a row. ==References== Category:Members of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Category:Maharashtra MLAs 2014–2019 Category:Living people Category:Independent politicians in India Category:People from Amravati district Category:1985 births
